title: Yet Another Stupid Death
data:
**Yet Another Stupid Death** (commonly abbreviated to **YASD**) is used when a player has done something, usually avoidable, that leads to his or her demise. Common YASDs in *NetHack* include:

- Hitting a [floating eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye") in [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") combat, then getting nibbled to death by a [newt](/wiki/Newt "Newt") while [paralyzed](/wiki/Paralyzed "Paralyzed")
- Attempting to engage [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") combat with very low [HP](/wiki/HP "HP") left
- Being killed by a [water demon](/wiki/Water_demon "Water demon") or [water moccasin](/wiki/Water_moccasin "Water moccasin") after [quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") from a [fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain") in hopes of getting a [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish")
- Not noticing that your character has gotten weak from [hunger](/wiki/Hunger "Hunger"), then being attacked when he/she faints
- Not noticing that your character is satiated, then greedily eating a corpse for intrinsics and choking
- Touching, eating, fighting [bare-handed](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands"), or otherwise manipulating a [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice"), its [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"), or its [egg](/wiki/Egg "Egg")
- [Drowning](/wiki/Drowning "Drowning") in [water](/wiki/Water "Water") or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava")
- [Genociding](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") oneself
- Eating rotten food after recently [praying](/wiki/Praying "Praying")
- Eating something you shouldn't eat (e.g. [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa")'s [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")—"hey, there's a [melon](/wiki/Melon "Melon") on the ground!")
- Zapping a [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death") (or some other powerful [ray](/wiki/Ray "Ray")) at a wall and getting hit by the rebound
- Wandering near a known [giant eel](/wiki/Giant_eel "Giant eel") or [kraken](/wiki/Kraken "Kraken")
- [Death by boredom](/wiki/Death_by_boredom "Death by boredom")
- Being [smote](/wiki/Anger#Smiting "Anger") by [sacrificing](/wiki/Sacrificing "Sacrificing") a [unicorn](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn") on an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") of its own alignment
- [Kicking](/wiki/Kick "Kick") and injuring your foot resulting in death due to low health
- Falling off your [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight")'s starting [pony](/wiki/Pony "Pony") after attempting to [ride](/wiki/Ride "Ride") it at [XL](/wiki/XL "XL") 1
- [Wishing](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for a cross-aligned [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact"), and having it [blast](/wiki/Artifact_blast "Artifact blast") you to death
- Forgetting about the power of [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth")
- Dying in possession of an identified [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving"), but not wearing it simply because you forgot to put it on
- Forgetting that you have low health when restoring a save file and immediately starting to explore
- Consorting with a [foocubus](/wiki/Foocubus "Foocubus") at XL 1 and dying from level drain or exhaustion.

Some players distinguish YASD from **YAAD** (**Yet Another Annoying Death**), using YAAD or [DYWYPI](/wiki/DYWYPI "DYWYPI") for random, unavoidable events such as falling onto [poison spikes](/wiki/Spiked_pit "Spiked pit") (provided the [pit](/wiki/Pit "Pit") wasn't already known, of course) or an encounter with a [Gnome With the Wand of Death](/wiki/Gnome_With_the_Wand_of_Death "Gnome With the Wand of Death"), and reserving YASD for pilot error. The dividing line depends on the player; to an expert, almost all deaths are avoidable YASDs.

Amusingly enough, YASDs can happen to [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") as well, such as bouncing a beam off a wall back at themselves.

## See also

- [Lessons learned the hard way](/wiki/Lessons_learned_the_hard_way "Lessons learned the hard way")
- [Bad Idea](/wiki/Bad_Idea "Bad Idea")
html:
Yet Another Stupid Death

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Yet Another Stupid Death (commonly abbreviated to YASD) is used when a player has done something, usually avoidable, that leads to his or her demise. Common YASDs in NetHack include:

  • Hitting a floating eye in melee combat, then getting nibbled to death by a newt while paralyzed
  • Attempting to engage melee combat with very low HP left
  • Being killed by a water demon or water moccasin after quaffing from a fountain in hopes of getting a wish
  • Not noticing that your character has gotten weak from hunger, then being attacked when he/she faints
  • Not noticing that your character is satiated, then greedily eating a corpse for intrinsics and choking
  • Touching, eating, fighting bare-handed, or otherwise manipulating a cockatrice, its corpse, or its egg
  • Drowning in water or lava
  • Genociding oneself
  • Eating rotten food after recently praying
  • Eating something you shouldn't eat (e.g. Medusa's corpse—"hey, there's a melon on the ground!")
  • Zapping a wand of death (or some other powerful ray) at a wall and getting hit by the rebound
  • Wandering near a known giant eel or kraken
  • Death by boredom
  • Being smote by sacrificing a unicorn on an altar of its own alignment
  • Kicking and injuring your foot resulting in death due to low health
  • Falling off your Knight's starting pony after attempting to ride it at XL 1
  • Wishing for a cross-aligned artifact, and having it blast you to death
  • Forgetting about the power of Elbereth
  • Dying in possession of an identified amulet of life saving, but not wearing it simply because you forgot to put it on
  • Forgetting that you have low health when restoring a save file and immediately starting to explore
  • Consorting with a foocubus at XL 1 and dying from level drain or exhaustion.

Some players distinguish YASD from YAAD (Yet Another Annoying Death), using YAAD or DYWYPI for random, unavoidable events such as falling onto poison spikes (provided the pit wasn't already known, of course) or an encounter with a Gnome With the Wand of Death, and reserving YASD for pilot error. The dividing line depends on the player; to an expert, almost all deaths are avoidable YASDs.

Amusingly enough, YASDs can happen to monsters as well, such as bouncing a beam off a wall back at themselves.

See also

  • Lessons learned the hard way
  • Bad Idea
Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Yet_Another_Stupid_Death&oldid=175945"

rawPage:
'''Yet Another Stupid Death''' (commonly abbreviated to '''YASD''') is used when a player has done something, usually avoidable, that leads to his or her demise. Common YASDs in ''NetHack'' include:

*Hitting a [[floating eye]] in [[melee]] combat, then getting nibbled to death by a [[newt]] while [[paralyzed]]
*Attempting to engage [[melee]] combat with very low [[HP]] left
*Being killed by a [[water demon]] or [[water moccasin]] after [[quaff]]ing from a [[fountain]] in hopes of getting a [[wish]]
*Not noticing that your character has gotten weak from [[hunger]], then being attacked when he/she faints
*Not noticing that your character is satiated, then greedily eating a corpse for intrinsics and choking
*Touching, eating, fighting [[bare hands|bare-handed]], or otherwise manipulating a [[cockatrice]], its [[corpse]], or its [[egg]]
*[[Drowning]] in [[water]] or [[lava]]
*[[Scroll of genocide|Genociding]] oneself
*Eating rotten food after recently [[praying]]
*Eating something you shouldn't eat (e.g. [[Medusa]]'s [[corpse]]—"hey, there's a [[melon]] on the ground!")
*Zapping a [[wand of death]] (or some other powerful [[ray]]) at a wall and getting hit by the rebound
*Wandering near a known [[giant eel]] or [[kraken]]
*[[Death by boredom]]
*Being [[Anger#Smiting|smote]] by [[sacrificing]] a [[unicorn]] on an [[altar]] of its own alignment
*[[Kick]]ing and injuring your foot resulting in death due to low health
*Falling off your [[Knight]]'s starting [[pony]] after attempting to [[ride]] it at [[XL]] 1
*[[Wish]]ing for a cross-aligned [[artifact]], and having it [[artifact blast|blast]] you to death
*Forgetting about the power of [[Elbereth]]
*Dying in possession of an identified [[amulet of life saving]], but not wearing it simply because you forgot to put it on
*Forgetting that you have low health when restoring a save file and immediately starting to explore
*Consorting with a [[foocubus]] at XL 1 and dying from level drain or exhaustion.

Some players distinguish YASD from '''YAAD''' ('''Yet Another Annoying Death'''), using YAAD or [[DYWYPI]] for random, unavoidable events such as falling onto [[Spiked pit|poison spikes]] (provided the [[pit]] wasn't already known, of course) or an encounter with a [[Gnome With the Wand of Death]], and reserving YASD for pilot error. The dividing line depends on the player; to an expert, almost all deaths are avoidable YASDs.

Amusingly enough, YASDs can happen to [[monster]]s as well, such as bouncing a beam off a wall back at themselves.
